title.narrative: Operationalizing the joint promotion of seed potatoes in Uganda

description.narrative:
Uganda National Seed Potato Producers (UNSPPA) is a farmer organization in Uganda which was formed in 1995 and registered under the company’s act since October 1997. The head offices are located in Kabale, South Western part of Uganda. The major operational area includes but not limited to Kabale, Rubanda, Rukiga, Kisoro, Rukungiri and Kanungu districts which are the major potato producing areas in Uganda. Currently, UNSPPA has with 436 (231 females & 205 males) individual registered members and 4712 (2928 females & 1784 males) affiliated members through community based groups. The Association is open for all farmers’ organizations and individuals all over Uganda engaged in seed potato production. UNSPPA’s vision is to “Enable a self-sustaining seed potato production system for increased food security and income at house hold levels in Uganda”, with the main objective of promoting the production and distribution of improved seed potatoes in Uganda.
The general objective for ''Operationalizing the joint promotion of seed potatoes in Uganda'' project is the strengthening of the operations of UNSPPA, the farmer-led organization in Uganda in their efforts to realize their BHAG related to becoming the leader in production and distribution of improved seed potatoes in Uganda.
The overall goal of the project is to strengthen the governance and financial management of UNSPPA which form the basis for the organization to be able to fulfill their mission to promote the production and distribution of quality seed potatoes in Uganda
Advise days. The value is summarized by year
